intro: Cyanea dolichopoda, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cyanea dolichopoda plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
